column4: is there a reason why not all packages (e.g. terminator) have the "Supported: " entry? normally there is an info about the length of security-support
cause "terminator" is part of universe and universe has no security guarantee whatsoever
so the community is managing universe instead of canocial?
ok, short story is canocial is building the packages with security-updates when the community is providing the security-patches
of course oracle is releasing java for linux
its just not allowed to distribut it in an own package
which means it will be dead for all distros
most of the software is working with openjdk
for the rest, download java from oracle
not even pae is necessary (not exactly a good solution either, but still doable)
what is the other way without pae and without amd64?
using an amd64 kernel with 32bit userland is much more useless then pae...
